intro: Kaempferia galanga var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf galangal, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its broad, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The botanical features of this variety make it distinct from other galangal species, particularly in leaf morphology and floral structure.
